TI_TEXT.P: Услуги на здравеопазването и социалните дейности

Usluge u području zdravstva i socijalne skrbi
Servizi sanitari e di assistenza sociale
Sveikatos priežiūros ir socialinio darbo paslaugos
Servizzi dwar saħħa ta' xogħol soċjali

Servicii de sănătate şi servicii de asistenţă socială
Storitve na področju zdravstva in socialnega varstva

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of social care services within 4 new supported living schemes (known as "Younger Adults Extra Care" schemes) across Hampshire, specifically in Aldershot, Basingstoke, Chineham and New Milton.The services will support people with a range of learning disabilities and additional complex social care needs, including physical disabilities and needs associated with autistic spectrum disorder. The services have been procured through a mini-competition procurement exercise, the services for each scheme tendered as a single contract lot, contracts being call-off contracts from a framework, specifically the Hampshire shared living and Learning disability support framework. For each of the four lots the initial contract term will be 3 years, with scope at the Council’s discretion for 2 additional extension periods each of up to 2 years. Organisations were able to bid for as many of the 4 lots as they wished, but could only be awarded a maximum of one contract.

The services have been procured through a mini-competition procurement exercise, the services for Lot 1 Aldershot tendered as a single contract lot, the contract being a call-off contract from a framework, specifically the Hampshire shared living and Learning disability support framework. For Lot 1 the initial contract term will be 3 years, with scope at the Council’s discretion for 2 additional extension periods each of up to 2 years. Organisations were able to bid for as many of the 4 lots as they wished, but could only be awarded a maximum of one contract.

Lot 1: Aldershot younger adults extra care service (the scheme) will be an accommodation based supported living scheme delivering a range of social care and support activities to people with learning disabilities, physical disabilities, autism spectrum conditions and other assessed social care needs. Those living at the scheme will be younger adults, ordinarily aged 18 and over, assessed as eligible for Social Care under the Care Act 2014, and who have an on-going need for the minimum level of support provided at the scheme. The accommodation is being built by Hampshire County Council (the Council) and consists of a block of 10 single-occupancy, self-contained, flats together with some scheme communal areas.The services will support Service Users to manage and maintain their tenancies and to access their local community and its resources. Service Users will be supported to have as much choice and control of their lives as possible, and to maximise their skills within their capabilities. The core of the service delivery will be about Positive risk taking, Positive behaviour support and Least restrictive practice. There will also be a focus on excellent support from staff and management of the scheme.The following is the expected range of support levels that will be required depending on the specific needs of the individuals who move in to the scheme:
Day time hours: Anticipated core hours: Between 210 – 315 hours each week, Additional 1:1 hours: Up to 535 hours each week.
Night support: Waking night: Up to 1 waking night staff each night. Sleep in support: Up to 1 sleep in staff each night.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: There is an option, at the Council's sole discretion, to extend the contract beyond the initial 3 year term, for a period not exceeding 4 years in total in two 2 year extension periods.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The services have been procured through a mini-competition procurement exercise, the services for Lot 2 Basingstoke tendered as a single contract lot, the contract being a call-off contract from a framework, specifically the Hampshire shared living and Learning disability support framework. For Lot 2 the initial contract term will be 3 years, with scope at the Council’s discretion for 2 additional extension periods each of up to 2 years. Organisations were able to bid for as many of the 4 lots as they wished, but could only be awarded a maximum of one contract.

Lot 2: Basingstoke. The Basingstoke specialist housing younger adults extra care scheme will be an accommodation based supported living scheme delivering a range of social care and support activities to people with learning disabilities and physical disabilities, health conditions and high levels of physical care needs. Those living at the scheme will be younger adults, ordinarily aged 18 and over, assessed as eligible for Social care under the Care Act 2014, and who have an on-going need for the minimum level of support provided at the scheme. The accommodation is being built by Hampshire County Council (The Council) and consists of 2 semi-detached bungalows each with 3 bedrooms. The scheme will support Service users to manage and maintain their tenancies and to access their local community and its resources. Service users will be supported to have as much choice and control of their lives as possible, and to maximise their skills within their capabilities. The core of the service delivery will be about Positive risk taking, Positive behaviour support and Least restrictive practice. There will also be a focus on excellent support from staff and management of the scheme.The following is the expected range of support levels that will be required depending on the specific needs of the individuals who move in to the scheme:
Day time hours: Anticipated core hours: Between 210 – 315 hours each week, Additional 1:1 hours: Up to 315 hours each week.
Night support: Waking night: Up to 2 waking night staff each night. Sleep in support: Up to 1 sleep in staff each night.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: There is an option, at the Council's sole discretion, to extend the contract beyond the initial 3 year term, for a period not exceeding 4 years in total in 2 2-year extension periods.

MAIN_SITE.P: Chineham, near Basingstoke in the north of Hampshire, England.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The services have been procured through a mini-competition procurement exercise, the services for Lot 3 Chineham tendered as a single contract lot, the contract being a call-off contract from a framework, specifically the Hampshire shared living and Learning disability support framework. For Lot 3 the initial contract term will be 3 years, with scope at the Council’s discretion for 2 additional extension periods each of up to 2 years. Organisations were able to bid for as many of the 4 lots as they wished, but could only be awarded a maximum of one contract.

Lot 3: Chineham. The Chineham younger adults extra care scheme will be an accommodation based supported living scheme delivering a range of social care and support activities to people with learning disabilities, physical disabilities, autism spectrum conditions and other assessed social care needs. Those living at the scheme will be younger adults, ordinarily aged 18 and over, assessed as eligible for Social care under the Care Act 2014, and who have an on-going need for the minimum level of support provided at the scheme. The accommodation is being built by Hampshire County Council (The Council) consisting of a block of 18 single-occupancy, self-contained, flats together with some scheme communal areas. The scheme will support Service Users to manage and maintain their tenancies and to access their local community and its resources. Service Users will be supported to have as much choice and control of their lives as possible, and to maximise their skills within their capabilities. The core of the service delivery will be about Positive risk taking, Positive behaviour support and Least restrictive practice. There will also be a focus on excellent support from staff and management of the scheme.The following is the expected range of support levels that will be required depending on the specific needs of the individuals who move in to the scheme:
Day time hours: Anticipated core hours: Between 315 – 525 hours each week, Additional 1:1 hours: Up to 840 hours each week.
Night support: Waking night: Up to 2 waking night staff each night. Sleep in support: Up to 2 sleep in staff each night.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: There is an option, at the Council's sole discretion, to extend the contract beyond the initial 3 year term, for a period not exceeding 4 years in total in 2 2-year extension periods.

MAIN_SITE.P: New Milton, in the south of Hampshire, England.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The services have been procured through a mini-competition procurement exercise, the services for Lot 4 New Milton tendered as a single contract lot, the contract being a call-off contract from a framework, specifically the Hampshire shared living and learning disability support framework. For Lot 4 the initial contract term will be 3 years, with scope at the Council’s discretion for 2 additional extension periods each of up to 2 years. Organisations were able to bid for as many of the 4 lots as they wished, but could only be awarded a maximum of one contract.

Lot 4: New Milton. The New Milton younger adults extra care scheme will be an accommodation based supported living scheme delivering a range of social care and support activities to people with learning disabilities, physical disabilities, autism spectrum conditions and other assessed social care needs. Those living at the scheme will be younger adults, ordinarily aged 18 and over, assessed as eligible for Social Care under the Care Act 2014, and who have an on-going need for the minimum level of support provided at the scheme. The accommodation is being built by Hampshire County Council (the Council) consisting of a block of 18 single-occupancy, self-contained, flats together with some scheme communal areas. The scheme will support Service Users to manage and maintain their tenancies and to access their local community and its resources. Service Users will be supported to have as much choice and control of their lives as possible, and to maximise their skills within their capabilities. The core of the service delivery will be about Positive risk taking, Positive behaviour support and Least restrictive practice. There will also be a focus on excellent support from staff and management of the scheme.The following is the expected range of support levels that will be required depending on the specific needs of the individuals who move in to the scheme:
Day time hours: Anticipated core hours: Between 420 – 525 hours each week, Additional 1:1 hours: Up to 1155 hours each week.
Night support: Waking night: Up to 2 waking night staff each night. Sleep in support: Up to 2 sleep in staff each night.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: There is an option, at the Council's sole discretion, to extend the contract beyond the initial 3 year term, for a period not exceeding 4 years in total in 2 2-year extension periods.

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.OFFICIALNAME: Community Homes Of Intensive Care and Education (CHOICE) Limited
ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: Linden House, Lime Walk, Bagshot Road

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: As set out in the Public Contracts Directive 2014/24/EU.
